layerItems.description:
OpenEmbedded-Core is a layer containing the core metadata for current versions
of OpenEmbedded. It is distro-less (can build a functional image with
DISTRO = "nodistro") and contains only emulated machine support.
layerItems.name: openembedded-core

layerItems.description: Filesystem related libraries and programs.  Includes support for FUSE and related components.
layerItems.name: meta-filesystems

recipes.description: The xfsdump package contains xfsdump, xfsrestore and a                number of other utilities for administering XFS filesystems.               xfsdump examines files in a filesystem, determines which                need to be backed up, and copies those files to a                specified disk, tape or other storage medium.
recipes.summary: XFS Filesystem Dump Utility

recipes.description: As new exfat filesystem is merged into linux-5.7 kernel, exfatprogs is created as an official userspace utilities that contain all of the standard utilities for creating and fixing and debugging exfat filesystem in linux system. The goal of exfatprogs is to provide high performance and quality at the level of exfat utilities in windows. And this software is licensed under the GNU General Public License Version 2.
recipes.summary: exFAT filesystem userspace utilities
Tool to access UFS (Universal Flash Storage) devices
File system check utility for OverlayFS
A command line Linux program which mounts and unmounts removable devices
Tools for Flash-Friendly File System (F2FS)
XFS Filesystem Utilities

recipes.inherits: autotools autotools-brokensep siteconfig siteinfo useradd useradd_base
recipes.summary: File system QA test suite
Tools for managing AUFS mounts

recipes.description: This tool is designed to manipulate FAT filesystems, in order to explore, extract, repair, recover and forensic them. It currently supports FAT12, FAT16 and FAT32.
recipes.summary: FAT filesystems explore, extract, repair, and forensic tool
Resize FAT partitions using libparted

recipes.description: A set of scripts supplementing the btrfs filesystem and aims     to automate a few maintenance tasks. This means the scrub, balance, trim     or defragmentation.
recipes.summary: Services for periodic btrfs maintenance tasks

recipes.description: xorriso copies file objects from POSIX compliant filesystems into Rock Ridge enhanced ISO 9660 filesystems and allows session-wise manipulation of such filesystems
recipes.inherits: autotools autotools-brokensep features_check pkgconfig siteconfig siteinfo

recipes.description: FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace) is a simple interface for userspace                programs to export a virtual filesystem to the Linux kernel. FUSE                also aims to provide a secure method for non privileged users to                create and mount their own filesystem implementations.
recipes.inherits: meson meson-routines pkgconfig ptest python3-dir python3native qemu siteinfo
recipes.summary: Implementation of a fully functional filesystem in a userspace program

recipes.description: FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace) is a simple interface for userspace                programs to export a virtual filesystem to the Linux kernel. FUSE                also aims to provide a secure method for non privileged users to                create and mount their own filesystem implementations.
recipes.inherits: autotools pkgconfig siteconfig siteinfo systemd update-rc.d
recipes.summary: Implementation of a fully functional filesystem in a userspace program
PhysicsFS is a library to provide abstract access to various archives
A fuse filesystem to access the contents of an iPhone or iPod Touch
A FUSE based implemention of unionfs

recipes.description: OWFS is an easy way to use the powerful 1-wire system of Dallas/Maxim
recipes.inherits: autotools autotools-brokensep pkgconfig siteconfig siteinfo systemd update-rc.d
recipes.summary: 1-Wire file system

recipes.description: SMBNetFS is a Linux/FreeBSD filesystem that allow you to use                samba/microsoft network in the same manner as the network                neighborhood in Microsoft Windows. Please donate me to help                in SMBNetFS development.
recipes.summary: FUSE module for mounting an entire SMB/NMB network in a single directory

recipes.description: LogFS is a Linux log-structured and scalable flash file system, intended for use on large devices of flash memory. It is written by Jörn Engel and in part sponsored by the CE Linux Forum. LogFS is included in the mainline Linux kernel and was introduced in version 2.6.34, released on May 16, 2010.
recipes.summary: LogFS Programs: used to create LogFS file system

recipes.inherits: autotools kernel-arch module-base pkgconfig siteconfig siteinfo
recipes.summary: OpenZFS on Linux and FreeBSD

recipes.summary: Meta-filesystem packagegroups

recipes.description: SIMPLE-MTPFS is a FUSE based filsystem for MTP devices connected via USB

recipes.description: fuse-exfat is a read and write driver implementing the extended file allocation table as a filesystem in userspace. A mounthelper is provided under the name mount.exfat-fuse.
recipes.summary: read and write exFAT driver for FUSE
